channel.title: BBC News - World
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Russian soldier pleads guilty in first war crimes trial of Ukraine conflict
item.description: The 21-year-old admits killing an unarmed civilian, in Ukraine's first war crimes trial since war began.

item.title: Pennsylvania primary: Trump-backed 'Dr Oz' in cliffhanger vote count
item.description: Celebrity surgeon Mehmet Oz's bid to become the next Republican senator from Pennsylvania is in jeopardy.

item.title: AG Perarivalan: India top court frees killer of ex-PM Rajiv Gandhi
item.description: AG Perarivalan spent 30 years in jail for procuring batteries used in the bomb to kill India's former PM.

item.title: US Soccer equal-pay deal could 'change game globally'
item.description: An equal-pay agreement between the United States men's and women's teams has been hailed as potentially "changing the game around the world".

item.title: McDonald's and Wendy's sued for burger ads that mislead on size
item.description: A lawsuit accuses the firms of advertising burgers that look bigger than they actually are.

item.title: China Eastern plane crash likely intentional, US reports say
item.description: Flight data reportedly indicates someone in the cockpit made the China Eastern Airlines jet crash.

item.title: Cyclone Yakecan batters Uruguay and Brazil
item.description: At least two people are dead and hundreds of thousands have been left without electricity.

item.title: Gambler to pay back Japanese Covid-19 fund he spent
item.description: The man's lawyer said his client gambled the pay-out after it was mistakenly paid to his bank account.

item.title: US military probe finds no wrongdoing in deadly Syria air strike
item.description: Dozens of people, including women and children, were killed in the 2019 strike on an IS position.

item.title: Cyclist abandons race after popping cork in eye
item.description: Italy's Alberto Dainese is a surprise winner of stage 11 of the Giro d'Italia after Biniam Girmay was forced to abandon this year's race.

item.title: Lancet study: Pollution killed 2.3 million Indians in 2019
item.description: The report found that nearly 1.6 million deaths in India were due to air pollution alone.

item.title: Ukraine war: 'I had to stay below ground for more than 60 days'
item.description: Katerina spent more than two months beneath the besieged Azovstal steel plant in Mariupol, Ukraine.

item.title: Mariupol's Azovstal fighters: What next for Ukraine's captured soldiers
item.description: Ukraine wants to exchange them for Russian prisoners of war, but some in Russia want them put on trial.

item.title: Capitol riots loom large in Republican primaries
item.description: Deniers of the 2020 election results are among the biggest winners of the Republican primary

item.title: Afghanistan: The secret girls school defying the Taliban
item.description: The teachers fear being arrested or beaten after the Taliban banned most teenage girls from education.

item.title: Australia election: A simple guide
item.description: Australians go to the polls on 21 May, for the country's first election since 2019.

item.title: Philly Lutaaya: The Ugandan singer who led the fight against HIV prejudice
item.description: HIV-positive Ugandan singer Philly Lutaaya was ostracised by some but his openness shifted attitudes.

item.title: Måneskin's crazy rise to fame: 'We only slept in our own beds 10 times last year'
item.description: The Italian rock band relive the highs and lows of becoming a global success after winning Eurovision.

item.title: Lebanon election results raise spectre of new power struggle
item.description: Prolonged deadlock could ensue after Hezbollah's allies lost seats to their rivals, says Anna Foster.

item.title: Mariupol: Key moments in the siege of the city
item.description: As Ukrainian fighters are evacuated from the Azovstal steelworks, how Russia has closed in on the city.

item.title: Buffalo shooting: How far-right killers are radicalised online
item.description: A movement of online extremists targets innocent people in shooting rampages that follow a similar blueprint.

item.title: Anti-abortion groups target women with misleading ads
item.description: Abortion providers describe a battle to put out accurate information.

item.title: Woman kidnapped as a child reunites with rescuer
item.description: Kathy Wrethman, from Australia, has finally come face-to-face with the man who saved her life.

item.title: China's silenced feminist: How Sophia Huang Xueqin went missing
item.description: BBC Eye investigates the disappearance of Sophia Huang Xueqin, a high-profile feminist journalist who kick-started China’s #MeToo movement.

item.title: Scott Morrison crashes into a boy during football match
item.description: Scott Morrison was playing five-a-side on the campaign trail ahead of Australia's election on Saturday.

item.title: Sweden and Finland formally submit Nato applications
item.description: The alliance's secretary general Jens Stoltenberg says it is "a historic moment, which we must seize".

item.title: Colombian robbery victim crashes car into thieves
item.description: The thieves stole a watch and mobile phone before the victim drove into them in his convertible.
